title: Welcome to the Oasis, Please Login
description: No killer app exists to bring a mass number of people into the Cardano ecosystem utilizing Decentralized IDs.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal highlighted the absence of a killer app as a problem and proposed a solution which is a video game utilising various tools of the cardano blockchain besides Atala Prism DID which is very unique, however there is no link to verify experience or identity of the proposer as claimed by the proposal "relative experience section".
Being a game developer for 15 years, the MVP deliverables  being ready in 2 months will require exception game development skill which i know Chad Carter posses(I have used his Microsoft XNA title while learning game development ).

Considering the lack of verifiable link of given experience provided in the proposal and the 2 Month MVP delivery timeline, i can neither agree nor disagree.

i  neither agree nor disagree

f6_assessments.q0:
The challenge is asking for a way to drive mass-scale adoption of DID usage as an easy-to-use onramp to the Cardano ecosystem.
The problem and solution statements are clear and reasonable.
The goal of a MVP of a virtual world that requires DIDs to access aligns with the challenge objective, although DID functionality is not central to the solution.
The proposal is not able to scale to drawing in millions of DID users with this round of funding which is for a MVP. The proposal requires future funding before any significant DID usage.
Based upon my experience, I disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has provided sufficient evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal however there are no references or links.
The team of one developer has been sufficiently identified in terms of skills and number required to implement the proposal.
The budget to achieve the goals is very high for 2 months work compared to other proposals and is not broken down into identifiable items.
Additional funding is required to develop the product to the point that the challenge objectives would be met, the proposer has provided a plan on obtaining these funds including NFT sales, stake pool, subscriptions and submitting another proposal in Fund 7.
The timetable is realistic to complete the work but does not show what is being done and when.
The plan describes the resources necessary, a cloud hosting service, to implement the proposal although the budget for this rolled into a lump sum.
Although not separately categorized, the proposal does identify risks and challenges to a successful implementation in the form of future financing and Atala Prism integration
A development team of one also poses a risk from unforeseen circumstances.
Based upon my experience, I neither agree nor disagree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides a roadmap with a single auditable milestone and a defined timeline of 3 months.
The proposal should include projected metrics that correspond to the challenge objective such as the number of DID users projected to be onboarded at specific time intervals and the recruitment cost per DID user. As a Minimum Viable Product, the number of DID users projected would be 0 however the proposal should project out to a timeline in which the community could expect DID users to be recruited assuming future funding. When could the community expect the challenge objectives to be measurably met if this project were funded? 
The proposal should detail specifically how progress will be reported back to the Catalyst community at regular intervals. The community will be able to login to the virtual world after the MVP is created to audit future development
Based upon my experience, I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: Its a great idea but I believe this proposal should have been entered under NFT Business models since the core of this business model is build around NFTs and transactions. A can see how requiring people to have Atala Prism DID to enter the game will "onboard" more users to DID, however, as mentioned above I think the proposal is not in the right catagory.
f6_assessments.q1: Although the proposal provided a description of relative experience of the team member, I feel the proposal requires further development to ensure successful implementation. I would like to see links to LinkedIn or similar to provide additional detail/evidence about work history, education and past experiences. I advise the team to develop a risk assessment considering the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation, the team needs to think: "what needs to be true for this project to succeed".
f6_assessments.q2: The team provided MVP deliverable without roadmap timelines and single line budget. I would like to see the team further develop and define Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) for the project– set measurables for performance and use it as a KPI, then connect the KPI to the milestones on the project roadmap. Lastly connect the KPI's and roadmap milestones to the developer budget, in this way you can track performance and spending over a timeline . As the project stand at the moment, I feel the project will be challenging to audit.

f6_assessments.q0:
I certainly appreciate the ambition of this proposal! In terms of overall impact, a Cardano native token based 3D world along the lines of a SecondLife metaverse would, if it were to achieve the same popularity as the aforementioned, be an astounding success that really showcases Cardano's versatility to the world. Incorporating Atala Prism DID into the 3D world would be a real benefit, especially since there is an economic incentive in this metaverse. That being said, I did read Phil's comment and do share his concern that people do prefer a certain anonymity when engaging in virtual games.

More specifically regarding the impact portion of the assessment, this proposal articulates well that the Cardano ecosystem does not have a killer app and if constructed as the proposer imagines, this would definitely bring a lot on users into the Cardano ecosystem. I really like that the proposer is thinking about connecting to existing NFT Cardano-based technology to further integrate the Cardano blockchain into the project. Also, as a metaverse with no real restrictions, I can see that this project would be able to scale given enough resources.

Given the scope and ambition of the project, I have a few concerns related to its feasibility (which I'll articulate in the next section) but in terms of impact, I'd like to see a few more concrete metrics and goals (maybe a roadmap) that measure the project's impact. And these of course could change. But, I'd like to see them as it shows the proposer really thinking about step-by-step progress.
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the vast experience of the proposer, it is not my intention to underestimate his ability, but I do have multiple concerns as to the feasibility of such a broad and wide-ranging project. Particularly, the one over-arching concern I have in reading the proposal, I wonder how any one person could create all of the MVP deliverables in a 3-month period that the proposer is proposing (listed below):

Website for alpha signup / notification list
3D World running on the PC
Custom Avatars
In-World Welcome Center Area
Text Chat
Voice Chat
NFT Import / Wallet Connection
Native Token created

It seems like a lot. That being said, if the proposer could clarify how each could be done within the time-frame proposed, I would feel more comfortable rating this as more feasible.

As is, the proposer...
-has not indicated the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal (see above, if the proposer can successfully tackle all the components contriving the MVP, he should detail how so).
-has not outlined clearly and broken down the budget into identifiable items, therefore it doesn't seem reasonable to achieve the set goals (of the MVP).
-does not offer a realistic timetable to complete the work; but at the same time, he does indicate that he needs the time to determine the requirements for the project, and
-has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.

However, in favor of the proposal, the proposer does...
-provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how. But it would also be great if this plan were flushed out a bit more thoughfully.
-describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal and clearly explains technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies crucial for implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer defines well what he has conceived of as his MVP and provides a roadmap for future enhancements of the project. This of course depends on an additional funding round which would bring the ability to add more people to help the project further accelerate.

I would like clearer metrics/KPI's however that state in unequivocal terms what the success of the project looks like as currently the 3D world being imagined is overly broad and there seems much to do. For example, more clearly detailed ideas about what the world will actually look like once developed would be very helpful.
